file_content.text: We... just lost communication to the Guardian Holds. All our troops, their leaders....
If he takes the Guardian Holds, he can take Coronet City; that's the entire purpose of the Holds. Corellia is lost!
If we succumb to despair, there can only be failure; if we fight, we may succeed.
We cannot lose hope.
That is true. We must act.
The First Son doesn't know what my troops are capable of.
You still have my armies.
Yes. Nobody has seen your forces fight before. Not even Syo.
The First Son has the ability to hide his siblings. With him dead, we stand a chance.
Then I'll kill the First Son.
But if he controls the Guardian Holds, we're trapped.
We must ensure the Guardian Holds are not in enemy hands. But if they have fallen, your forces are our best hope to retake them.
We won't let you down, Master Satele.
Count on us.
I must find the First Son before he harms anyone else.
No, the First Son is priority.
But if you waste your armies hunting him, it will cost us the Guardian Holds. We will do what we can.
I thought the Guardian Holds were designed to be invulnerable.
Retaking them is impossible.
We must try. The First Son managed to capture them; perhaps that gives you an opening.
The closest is Guardian Hold Six, a large walker factory. Now you've cleared the Imperial forces, you should be able to reach it.
I'll tell our allies to meet us there, Jedi.
The closest is Guardian Hold Six, a large walker factory. General Aves's team could get you there, past any Imperial resistance.
I'll send word to our allies to meet us there, Jedi.
Speak to General Aves's aide, Corporal Hartke, about getting through the Imperial lines. And may the Force be with you.
Guardian Hold Six must be saved. If Syo--if the First Son has already struck, you are our only hope.
Ugh. Someone corrupted this file into a big, sticky mess. If there's anything about the First Son in here, it's all mixed up.
Ooh! The Jedi Archives! They restore old files all the time, don't they? If I linked in, I could fix this in a snap.
Only the Jedi Council can allow such access.
We'd need authorization.
The sooner we find out what's in that file, the better.
Good idea.
The Jedi Archives contain the wisdom of the galaxy. So don't start "reorganizing" anything.
Just behave yourself in there.
Sending a request to the Jedi Council now.
Ah, you're all right. Reports of the fighting on Corellia have been dire.
Indeed. We have the Guardian Holds to oversee, troops to organize, and you want to access the Jedi Archives? Now?
This file relates directly to the Children of the Emperor and their leader.
It's about the First Son.
In that case, you may have full access.
I wouldn't ask if it wasn't a matter of the highest importance.
Yes, Master. I'm sorry.
The longer we stand here talking, the more ground is lost on Corellia.
We're wasting time.
Very well. You have permission.
Restoration in progress. Done! The file is... is... Oh, Jedi. You need to see this, right now.
...too risky. My superiors here still think the Empire will forget its debts.
The Children of the Emperor will remind them. When the Republic falls, I will ensure Corellia's government is rewarded for aiding us.
But we've never heard of a "First Son"! How can we trust you're as powerful as you say?
Because we met once, Secretary. On Coruscant. Do you still doubt I can do anything I wish?
Perhaps some data crossed over from the Jedi Archives. Check the file again.
Holiday, you made a mistake.
Jedi, this is the original file. All I did was fix it.
I can't believe what I'm seeing.
Please, no. Not Master Syo.
So much suffering. Syo will pay for every life he's destroyed!
I'll kill him.
What have we done?
Contact Syo, quickly.
Ah, you've arrived. Your forces are landing; the Guardian Holds are standing strong. The battle may yet go our way.
Our way? Don't you mean the Emperor's? Isn't that who you really serve, "First Son"?
We have seen a transmission of you speaking to a Corellian politician, as the First Son.
And we have evidence of it.
We should give him a chance to explain.
Wait. Let Syo speak.
He is a traitor and a murderer. He deserves nothing but a quick death.
Don't waste breath on him.
Syo, please. Tell me this isn't true.
I'm afraid he cannot. I believe it is now Syo's turn to be silent, and watch.
Fate has set me a challenge. I had hoped for more time, but all things must adapt or die.
Release Syo Bakarn, immediately.
I cannot give up on Syo.
He is beneath your reach now, Jedi. In the place I was forced to occupy.
Then it is true.
You don't deny it?
I do respect the truth, and all its uses.
Death has become your only recourse.
You won't have time to adapt.
We shall see.
You kindly entrusted the Guardian Holds to me. And I, in turn, entrusted them to my brothers and sisters.
Goodbye, Jaric, Satele... and thank you.
Ah, you're back! The Selonians brought your friend in a little while ago.
Captain Drizan gave me kolto packs and a hot drink. I feel much better; no more escape pods for me.
Padawan Grell says you must fix corrupted file she found. Something important?
The captain here patched me up. Luckily, they build those escape pods tough.
Lieutenant mentioned you must fix corrupted file he found. Something important?
This file could help us catch one of the masterminds behind the war.
It may concern the First Son.
Oh. Wow. If you need our holotransmitter to check it, go right ahead.
That's correct. Could I borrow your holotransmitter?
Yes, and I need your holo.
Of course. We're all in this together.
I can't discuss it, those files are critical to Republic security.
That's confidential.
Er, okay. The holotransmitter's there if you need it.
We'll give privacy to work. Best luck, Jedi.
Be careful in Zone Twelve, we don't want any more losses.
I hope your friend makes it through.
Hate to bug you but we could really use those AA guns.
Nicely done! The droid patrol routes have enough gaps for us to sneak by, but they're tight enough the Empire may not realize there are holes.
Also, we found escape pod. Sighted in Zone Twelve. That's very bad. A lot of Imperials.
Your distress call mentioned that zone had been overrun.
What's Zone Twelve?
Zone Twelve's a private shipyard that happens to be a great defensive position. You're in for a fight.
If they opened the pod, Nadia may be their prisoner.
I hope Nadia's alright.
If they opened the pod, Felix may be their prisoner.
I hope Felix is alright.
Your friend will fight hard, I'm sure.
They won't be an obstacle.
Good luck helping your friend. Uh. I know your mission's urgent but... could you do us a favor?
What would you ask of me?
Possibly.
Ask, but I'm in a hurry.
We managed to convert two comm towers into AA guns. All good, 'til the Empire captured them.
But, there's an override to hardwire them for Imperial targets. Just enter this at both towers, and we get our guns back.
We don't expect you to neglect the pod for this, but we'd appreciate it.
My priority is reaching the escape pod, but if I have the opportunity, I'll do what I can.
My mission must come first.
Sure, absolutely. It's just--any help would make a huge difference.
Jedi. You stopped droids; honor demands we repay.
No promises.
No. I'm on a rescue mission.
Guess Jedi business comes first.
Even so. You stopped droids; honor demands we repay.
If you need help to free friend from pod, call. We Selonians will come.
I don't want your people in harm's way unnecessarily.
Don't risk yourselves for us.
That's a very generous offer, Quil.
Thank you.
All acceptable risk, if Imperials are thinned.
I was wondering when you'd decide to contribute.
So you are useful after all.
Hmph. Should be gracious, Jedi.
Be ready before you go near Zone Twelve. We need you in one piece.
Those droids are still on patrol. Once they're gone, our people will be free to find the pod.
Captain Drizan? I believe my allies sent a message. I need your help to find an escape pod.
Huh? I thought that was a hoax. Quil! Look, we really did get a Jedi Master.
Thought all Jedi were defending those Guardian Hold fortresses. Good to meet.
This is Quil; she and the other Selonians are helping us fight the Imperials. Your escape pod's somewhere in a hot zone.
The shipyard guidance system brought the pod in. Isn't there some record?
You don't know where it is?
No, the guidance controls were damaged. The pod could be anywhere, and recon's impossible.
Brief me on the situation.
The Empire bombed the shipyards and spaceport, then sent troops in. Now we can't even risk quick scouting missions.
I'm sure you can cope. But the contents of that escape pod could save the Republic.
I only care about the pod.
Stop. Go out there, you'll get us killed.
There are Imperial droids on patrol. When we leave, they follow us back to our bases and go on a killing spree. We're stuck.
Your pod's important, but I can't send anyone after it, not if those droids will track them.
I may be able to take care of them, depending on the numbers.
How many droids?
More come in with every troop transport.
They can't track anything with a lightsaber in their circuitry.
So I destroy the droids.
You're trapped by a few sniffer droids?
This is pathetic.
They're built tough, okay? We're not Jedi, we can't stand around whacking them with blaster fire raining down.
Cut them some slack. Imperials love toys like this.
You couldn't get them all. Wouldn't have to. Break a few, change their patrol routes, we sneak through.
Your scouts might still be vulnerable.
Bold but extremely risky.
War is all a risk. We fight for Corellia.
It will be done.
If I do this, I expect results from you.
Fine, just find my escape pod.
Don't doubt my scouts, Jedi.
Okay. You clear the droids, we'll find that pod. We should have something by the time you get back.
Unless this is about defending the shipyards, sorry, I don't have time.
And Imperials have put bombs at mouths of our tunnels to collapse. Many have died. Can you get rid?
That's deplorable, even for the Empire. Leave this to me.
I'll see what can be done.
Jedi, we were heading to Guardian Hold Six, the walker factory, when we received a distress signal. It's... it's bad.
Guardian Hold Six has been taken by the enemy, apparently from within. And the other Guardian Holds have fallen, too.
If someone's calling for help there must be survivors.
You mentioned a distress call.
The First Son mentioned hiding his "siblings" inside the Guardian Holds, but I thought we'd have more time.
The Children worked quickly.
We've had one stroke of luck, a very small one.
Once we retake Guardian Hold Six, we can concentrate on the others.
Then we must take them back.
I hope it's as straightforward as that.
Apparently a few soldiers escaped the fighting. They've made a small camp; we could meet you there and put a strategy together.
Let these soldiers know that reinforcements are on the way.
Tell them help is coming.
Actually, I'm not sure how that will be received.
That's fortunate. We need intelligence on what's happening.
Those soldiers could help us.
Er, they've not been very forthcoming.
Are they just rank-and-file soldiers, or is there an officer I can speak to?
Is there someone in authority?
Yes, but I don't know if he'll talk to you.
We tried contacting the man in charge, but he's being... difficult. Could you hurry?
I'll see what can be done.
